balinese: Cihna asu sané keni rabies inggih punika paosné akéh, jejeh tekén toya lan galang, tur ngancan galak.
english: The characteristics of dogs affected by rabies are large amounts of saliva, fear of light and water, and more fierce.
indonesian: Ciri-ciri anjing yang terkena rabies yaitu air liurnya banyak, takut dengan air dan cahaya, dan lebih galak.

balinese: ...majalan becik ring angga sarirané, sané ngawinang anggané kenak , seger oger tur bayuné gedé.
english: ...improve circulation in the body, which could maintain our stamina and keep our body fresh.
indonesian: ... menjadi bagus sirkulasinya di dalam tubuh yang mengakibatkan badan sehat, segar bugar dan tenaga kuat.

balinese: Ayu: Ragane sira pesengane? Wisnu: Wastan titiang Wisnu. Ayu mawit saking napi? Ayu: Tiang saking Karangasem. Wisnu: Sampun sue deriki?
english: Ayu: What's your name? Wisnu: My name is Wisnu. Ayu, where are you from? Ayu: I am from Karangasem. Wisnu: How long have you been here?
indonesian: Ayu: Siapa namanya? Wisnu: Nama saya Wisnu. Ayu asalnya dari mana? Ayu: Saya dari Karangasem. Wisnu: Sudah lama tingal di sini?

balinese: Tangan Idané akéh ngamedalang rah.
english: His hands were bleeding a lot.
indonesian: Tangan Beliau banyak mengeluarkan darah.

balinese: Putra: Om Swastiastu. Tantri: Om Swastiatu. Rahajeng rauh ring The Laguna Resort and Spa, Nusa Dua, Bali.
english: Putra: May peace be with you. Tantri: May peace be with you. Welcome to The Laguna Resort and Spa, Nusa Dua, Bali.
indonesian: Putra: Om Swastiastu. Tantri: Om Swastiatu. Selamat datang di The Laguna Resort and Spa, Nusa Dua, Bali.

balinese: Om Swastiastu. Nyanggra rahina Saraswati dinane mangkin, titiang makarya canang raka ajengan madaging raka, taluh, penek, lan saur, jaja, sekar amatra, lan kukus arum.
english: Peace, Happy Saraswati day, I have a canang raka (medium offering) containing food of eggs, fruits, dried grated coconut, cakes, some flowers, and kukus arum incense.
indonesian: Om Swastyastu, Selamat hari raya Saraswati, saya disini membuat canang raka (persembahan sederhana) makanan berisi dari telur, aneka buah, kelapa parut kering, kue, bunga, dan dupa kukus arum.

balinese: Om Swastiastu! Rahinane mangkin rahina Buda, pinanggal roras April kalih tali pitulas.
english: May everything is good on you with the grace of God! Today is Wednesday the twelfth of April two thousand and seventeen
indonesian: Semoga ada dalam keadaan baik/selamat atas karunia Tuhan! Hari ini hari Rabu tanggal dua belas April dua ribu tujuh belas

balinese: Sabilang rainan, makejang nyaman-nyaman tiange sareng mabakti mrika. Mih, Beli, kari maduwe babad sareng lelintihan punika?
english: Every temple ceremony, all of my family prays there. Wow, do you still have the Babad (ancient chronicle of family origin)?
indonesian: Setiap hari raya, semua saudara-saudara saya sembahyang bersama-sama ke sana. Wah, Kakak, masih memiliki sejarah dan uraian ceritanya itu?

balinese: Arya Tegeh Kori nika sane kapertama dadi raja ring Badung.
english: This Arya Tegeh Kori become the first king of Badung.
indonesian: Arya Tegeh Kori itulah yang pertama jadi raja di Badung.

balinese: Uling ija kaden tekan anginne, jeg nglinus di tengah Kamar 21. Jejeh lantas ia ajaka makejang. Buku ane bacana saget magejeran lan makeber. Uli bukune ento pesu raksasa-raksasa ane gobane serem. Makesiab lan kabilbil timpal-timpalne Luh Ayu Manik sada makita malaib. Nanging, makejang mamegeng cara togog tusing bisa nindakang batis. Keto masih I Wayan ajak I Made makita mageluran ka sisi. Nanging bibihne macaket sing nyidaang ngomong. “Eda ngomong liu, tongosang ibane dini, ne ajak timpal nyaine!” Keto raksasane mamunyi bangras.
english: Who knows where it came from, but suddenly there was a strong wind which swirled around 'Room 21' and they were gripped with fear. The book they were reading shook and flew about the room. Horrid demons appeared from the pages of the book. Luh Ayu Manik’s friends were shocked and confused and wanted to run away. But they couldn’t move. They were like statues and couldn’t move their feet. Also I Wayan and I Made wanted to call out but their lips were sealed and they couldn’t speak. “Don't say anything – you will remain here … with your friends,” bellowed the demon.
indonesian: Entah dari mana datangnya, angin kencang tiba-tiba berhembus di Kamar 21. Mereka semua ketakutan. Buku yang dibaca tiba-tiba bergetar dan terbang. Dari buku-buku itu keluarlah raksasa-raksasa yang rupanya seram. Teman-teman Luh Ayu Manik seketika terkejut dan bingung sembari ingin lari. Akan tetapi, mereka tidak bisa bergerak seperti patung, tidak bisa melangkahkan kaki. Begitu juga I Wayan dan I Made ingin berteriak ke luar, tetapi bibirnya terkatup tidak mampu berbicara. “Jangan banyak bicara, diamlah kalian di sini, ini ajak temanmu!” Ujar para raksasa tersebut kasar.

balinese: Ditu di tongos anaké ramé ento, anak sedeng manyi ento, mbok?
english: Sister, those crowds over there, is they harvesting there?
indonesian: Di sana tempat orang ramai tersebut, orang sedang memanen padi, Kak?

balinese: Ngeet don pandan harum lakar anggo kembang rampe. Yen di Klungkung, kembang rampe ento madan samsam.
english: Cutting pandanus leaf to make kembang rampe (shredded pandanus leaf) to be added to a canang (type of small offering). In Klungkung, kembang rampe is known as samsam.
indonesian: Memotong daun pandan harum untuk dijadikan kembang rampe (diisi pada canang). Kalau di Klungkung, kembang rampe dinamakan samsam.

balinese: Wayan lan timpal-timpalné randa-rundu ngalih taluh bébék di cariké.
english: Wayan and his friends flock here and there looking for duck eggs in the rice fields.
indonesian: Wayan dan teman-temannya berbondong-bondong ke sana ke mari mencari telor bebek di sawah.

balinese: Cerik-ceriké randang-rundung ngelidin ujan bales di rurungé.
english: The children moved here and there avoiding heavy rain on the road.
indonesian: Anak-anak itu berpindah ke sana ke mari menghindari hujan deras di jalan.

balinese: Buka becicane ujanan raos memene teken panakne, ane tusing seleg masuk.
english: Like a shama bird caught under a downpour, mother scolds her child who like to skip school.
indonesian: Seperti murai kehujanan bicara si Ibu pada anaknya yang tidak rajin sekolah.

balinese: Raris, dugas pratisentana undagan kaping empat, wenten biyuta, sane ngawinang raris ida ngungsi ka jagat Buleleng.
english: Then, in the 4th generation, there was a separation, which lead to people to take refuge to Buleleng area.
indonesian: Kemudian, saat keturunan keempat, terjadi perang, yang kemudian menyebabkan beliau mengungsi ke daerah Buleleng.

balinese: Om Swastiastu. Nawegang, dados tiang mataken? Om Swastiastu. Nggih rarisang, napi jagi takenang?
english: Peace be with you. Pardon, may I ask a question? Peace be with you. Yes, go ahead, what would you like to ask?
indonesian: Om Swastiastu. Permisi, boleh saya bertanya? Om swastiastu. Silakan, apa yang mau ditanyakan?

balinese: Suang-suang madue rasa seni sane matiosan.
english: We all have different opinion about artwork.
indonesian: Masing-masing memiliki rasa seni yang berlainan.

balinese: Kramané raya-ruyu ngiterin désa ngalih panakné Madé ané tusing mulih-mulih.
english: Residents crowded around the village in search of Madé’s son who did not go home yet.
indonesian: Warga berkerumun ke sana ke mari mengelilingi desa mencari anaknya Made yang tidak pulang-pulang.

balinese: Nguningayang situs web BASAbali Wiki majeng ring alit-alit Sanggar ARMA Kumara Sari ring rahina Redite, 27 Mei 2018 ring ARMA, Ubud.
indonesian: Mengenalkan situs web BASAbali Wiki kepada anak-anak Sanggar ARMA Kumara Sari pada Minggu, 27 Mei 2018 di ARMA, Ubud.

balinese: Yen nuju Saniscara kene, Luh Ayu Manik maan selah madaaran bareng-bareng tengaine ajak memenne. Disubane masalin baju, ia ngojog paon, memenne suba ngantiang ditu. Jemaka nasine, lan ia madaaran sambilanga nutur ajak memenne. Luh Ayu Manik ngorahang isin kenehne, yen Reditene buin mani ia dot nutug memenne ka Peken Anyar. Memenne maanggutan. Luh Ayu Manik girang kenehne. Suud madaaran ia cara biasane macelep ka Kamar 21.
english: On Saturdays, Luh Ayu Manik was able to have lunch with her mother. After changing out of her clothes, she went to the kitchen where her mother was waiting. She helped herself to some food and ate it while chatting with her mother. She told her mother of her plan to go to the market with her the following day, being a Sunday. Her mother nodded in approval. Luh Ayu Manik was so happy. After lunch she went to 'Room 21' as usual.
indonesian: Pada hari Sabtu seperti ini, Luh Ayu Manik mendapat kesempatan untuk makan bersama dengan ibunya. Setelah mengganti baju, ia menuju dapur, ibunya telah menunggu di sana. Ia mengambil nasi, dan ia makan sambil bercerita dengan ibunya. Luh Ayu Manik menceritakan niatnya pada hari Minggu esok ia ingin mengikuti ibunya ke Pasar Anyar. Ibunya mengangguk. Luh Ayu Manik bahagia hatinya. Setelah makan, seperti biasa ia masuk ke Kamar 21.

balinese: Sarwa budaya inggih punika parindikan sane nenten prasida katungkasin. Bali madue makudang-kudang budaya silih tunggilnyane sasolahan wali rejang sane madue variasi akeh tur akehan sasolahan rejang punika kasolahang ring galah sane matiosan utawi rikalaning upacara sane ageng. Silih tunggil sane mabuat rikalaning ngeliput rejang ring Karangasem daweg Umanis Kuningan inggih punika sasolahan sane lemuh tur gamelan sane ngelangenin, becik pisan, lestari budaya tiange.
english: Cultural diversity is undeniable. Bali has a diverse culture, one of which is a sacred rejang dance which has many variations and most of these rejang dances are danced at certain times or during big celebrations. One of the unique things when covering coverage in Karangasem at Umanis Kuningan is a graceful dance and a beautiful gamelan that is heard, very beautiful, preserved my culture.
indonesian: Keanekaragaman budaya merupakan hal yang tak terbantahkan. Bali memiliki budaya yang beragam salah satunya tarian sakral rejang yang memiliki banyak variasi dan kebanyakan tari rejang ini ditarikan diwaktu tertentu atau pada saat perayaan besar. Salah satu yang unik saat meliput rejang di Karangasem pada saat Umanis Kuningan adalah tarian yang lemah gemulai dan gamelan yang indah didengar, sangat indah, lestari budayaku.

balinese: Daweg rahina Kuningan lan Manis Kuningan (nyabran 210 rahina ring kalender Bali), yowana istri ngaturang sasolahan rejang ring pura Tista (Karangasem). Santukan ujan bales sasolahan punika kalaksanayang ring dua bale, nenten ring genah sane membak.
english: On Kuningan and Manis Kuningan (every 210 days on the Balinese calendar), teenage girls perform rejang dance in the temple in Tista (Karangasem). Because of the pouring rain the dance was done in two Bale instead of the open air.
indonesian: Saat Kuningan dan Manis Kuningan (setiap 210 hari pada kalender Bali), remaja perempuan mempersembahkan tari rejang di pura Tista (Karangasem). Karena hujan deras tarian itu dilakukan di dua balai, bukannya di ruang terbuka.

balinese: Sasolahan rejang lilit sane wantah kasolahang olih alit-alit miwah yowana, tur wantah dados kasolahang ring Pura Bale Agung Desa Adat Purwayu.
english: Rejang lilit dance which is only danced by children and adolescents, and can only be danced in the Bale Agung Temple Purwayu Cultural Village.
indonesian: Tarian rejang lilit yang hanya ditarikan oleh anak-anak dan remaja, dan hanya dapat ditarikan di Pura Bale Agung Desa Adat Purwayu.

balinese: Daweg kalih rahina wusan Kuningan (nyabran 210 rahina ring kalender Bali), yowana istri (saking yusa 10 warsa) ngaturang sasolahan rejang ring pura Purwayu (Karangasem). Santukan ujan bales sasolahan punika kalaksanayang ring bale gong, nenten ring genah sane membak.
english: On the two days after Kuningan (every 210 days on the Balinese calendar), young girls (from the age of 10) perform rejang dance in the temple in Purwayu (Karangasem). Because of the pouring rain the dance was done in the Bale Gong instead of the open air.
indonesian: Saat dua hari setelah Kuningan (setiap 210 hari pada kalender Bali), remaja perempuan (dari umur 10 tahun) mempersembahkan tari rejang di pura Purwayu (Karangasem). Karena hujan deras tarian itu dilakukan di balai gong, bukannya di ruang terbuka.

balinese: Malingé rejeka olih krama desané ngantos padem.
english: The thief was attacked by villagers to death.
indonesian: Maling itu diserang oleh warga desa hingga tewas.

balinese: Gulané rejeng semut di piringé.
english: The sugar was surrounded by ants on the plate.
indonesian: Gula itu dikerubuti semut di piring.

balinese: Jajané rejenga baan semuté ulian misi gula.
english: The cake is surrounded by ants because it contains sugar.
indonesian: Kue itu dikerubuti semut karena mengandung gula.

balinese: Réka gambar kidang di kertasé nganggon pénsil.
english: Make a sketch of the deer image on paper using a pencil.
indonesian: Reka/ buatkan sketsa gambar kijang itu di kertas menggunakan pensil.

balinese: Rékaang tiang gambar wangunan ané melah.
english: Please draw me a picture of a nice building.
indonesian: Gambarkan saya gambar bangunan yang bagus.

balinese: Togog I Tualén rékaanga kadi anak tua.
english: The statue of I Tualen was depicted like an old man.
indonesian: Patung I Tualen digambarkannya seperti orang tua.

balinese: Ukiran pintuné punika rékana nganggén paat sané mangan.
english: The carved door was formed using a sharp chisel.
indonesian: Ukiran pintu itu dibentuknya menggunakan pahat yang tajam.

balinese: Rékat pisan padangé tumbuh duaning sampun sué nénten wénten sabeh.
english: It's very difficult for the grass to grow because it hasn't rained for a long time.
indonesian: Sulit sekali rumput itu tumbuh karena sudah lama tidak turun hujan.

balinese: Ipun ngrereh rekata ring alas prapat.
english: He is looking for crabs in the mangrove forest.
indonesian: Dia mencari kepiting di hutan bakau.

balinese: Reké, umbi-umbian punika pinaka ajeng-ajengan serahina. Sané mangkin sampun kagentosin antuk nasi.
english: That said, the tubers are a daily food. Now it's been replaced by rice.
indonesian: Konon, umbi-umbian itu sebagai makanan sehari-hari. Sekarang sudah digantikan oleh nasi.

balinese: Rekés titiangé sampun kaaturang majeng ring Ida.
english: My request has been submitted to him.
indonesian: Permohonan saya sudah disampaikan kepada beliau.

balinese: Getah nangkané anggona ngejuk capung sawiréh reket gati.
english: Jackfruit sap is used to catch dragonflies because it is very sticky.
indonesian: Getah nangka digunakan menangkap capung karena sangat lengket.

balinese: Tiang belianga rékét baru tekén bapa.
english: I got a new racket from my father.
indonesian: Saya dibelikan raket baru oleh ayah.

balinese: Reketang gambaré ento di temboké.
english: Stick the picture on the wall.
indonesian: Lekatkan gambar itu di tembok.

balinese: Kain kasané reketanga di mejané aji lim.
english: The gauze is attached to the table using glue.
indonesian: Kain kasa itu dilekatkan di meja menggunakan lem.

balinese: Ia demen gati nganggo baju rékrék. Mirib mula kéto penganggo cara janiné.
english: He loves wearing striped clothes. Maybe it's really a trend in present day.
indonesian: Dia suka sekali memakai baju berbelang-belang. Mungkin memang begitu pakain jaman sekarang.

balinese: Awak panak tiangé remang. Dokteré ngicén tamba sirup apang énggal seger.
english: My child's body is rather hot. The doctor gives syrup medicine to get well soon.
indonesian: Badan anak saya agak panas. Dokter memberikan obat sirup agar cepat sembuh.

balinese: Bunga remawa pinaka cihna tresnan beliné tekén adi.
english: Roses as a sign of my love for you.
indonesian: Bunga mawar sebagai tanda cintaku kepadamu.

balinese: Remba gati yen kija-kija tusing ngaba tas.
english: It's very difficult if you don't carry a bag everywhere.
indonesian: Repot sekali kalau kemana-mana tidak membawa tas.

balinese: Eda gulgula, ia jani sedeng rembad.
english: Don't bother him, he is busy now.
indonesian: Jangan diganggu, ia sekarang sedang repot.

balinese: Tiang tusing demen ngorta ngajak anak ane bes rembag.
english: I don't like talking to people who are too wordy.
indonesian: Saya tidak suka berbicara dengan orang yang terlalu bertele-tele.

balinese: Ortané rembaga apang tiang mekelo ngoyong dini.
english: This talk is long-winded so I stay here for a long time.
indonesian: Pembicaraan ini dibicarakan bertele-tele agar saya lama diam di sini.

balinese: Nyabran rahina purnama, tiang nyarengin rembug sastra ring pura Jagatnata.
english: Every full moon day, I took part in a literature discussion at the Jagatnata temple.
indonesian: Setiap hari purnama, saya ikut diskusi sastra di pura Jagatnata.

balinese: Rembugang malu ajak timpal-timpale. Yen suba, orahang teken tiang.
english: Negotiate with your friends first. If so, let me know.
indonesian: Rundingkan dulu dengan teman-temanmu. Jika sudah, kabari saya.

balinese: Pikobet ring desa rembuganga mangda polih pamuput utawi margi sane becik.
english: The problems in the village were discussed to get a solution or a good way.
indonesian: Permasalahan di desa dirembukkannya agar memperoleh penyelesaian atau jalan yang baik.

balinese: Punyan binginé rembun gati. Ditu tiang sai maémbon rikala panes.
english: The banyan tree is very lush. I often shelter when it's hot at there.
indonesian: Pohon beringin itu sangat rimbun. Di sana saya sering berteduh ketika panas.

balinese: Ida reneh pisan mirengang tembangé punika.
english: He was very happy to hear the song.
indonesian: Beliau sangat senang mendengar lagu itu.

balinese: Suryaké suba renek. Ento cihna pamileté suba suud tampil.
english: The applause has subsided. That's a sign the participant has finished performing.
indonesian: Tepuk tangan itu sudah mereda. Itu pertanda peserta sudah selesai tampil.

balinese: Wantuan saking pemerintah punika kantun reneng. Kocap malih kalih rahina jagi kamargiang ring soang-soang désa.
english: The aid from the government is still frozen. He said two more days would be distributed to each village.
indonesian: Bantuan dari pemerintah itu masih beku. Katanya dua hari lagi akan dibagikan ke setiap desa.

balinese: Pabiananné renes pesan. Mémé teken bapa dueg gati mula di abiané.
english: The plants are orderly, neat and fertile. Mother and father are very good at growing crops.
indonesian: Tanaman-tanaman itu teratur, rapi dan subur. Ibu dan ayah pandai sekali menanam tanaman.

balinese: Tiang orahina meli réng di toko bangunané.
english: I was told to buy ‘reng’ in the building shop.
indonesian: Saya disuruh membeli reng di toko bangunan itu.

balinese: Ia tuara renga tekén tutur rerama.
english: He does not care about the advice of parents.
indonesian: Ia tidak hirau dengan nasehat orang tua.

balinese: Rengaang piteket anaké tua apang tusing maselselan.
english: Listen to the advice of parents, so you would not regret.
indonesian: Dengarkan nasehat orang tua agar tidak menyesal.

balinese: Cicingé ento rengas. Eda gulgula.
english: The dog is still wild. Do not disturb.
indonesian: Anjing itu masih liar. Jangan diganggu.

balinese: Cawané rengat ulian ketogina yéh panes dingin.
english: The cup cracked because it was poured a cold and hot water.
indonesian: Cangkir itu retak karena dituangi air panas dingin.

balinese: Tiang melajah ngaé jaja renges tekén mémé.
english: I learned to make ‘renges’ snacks with mother.
indonesian: Saya belajar membuat jajan renges dengan ibu.

balinese: Ia koné taén nepukin raksasa mabok barak tur macaling rénggah.
english: He said that he had seen a red haired monster with long and pointed nail.
indonesian: Ia katanya pernah melihat raksasa berambut merah dan bertaring panjang dan runcing.

balinese: Ia mula anak tiwas. Buina umahneé rénggang-rénggong ampehang angin baret.
english: He is indeed a poor child. Even his house was very damaged and almost collapsed in high winds.
indonesian: Dia memang anak kurang mampu. Bahkan rumahnya amat rusak dan hampir rubuh diterpa angin kencang.

balinese: Umah dadongé suba rénggong. Yen ada galah, tiang lakar menahin umahné dadong.
english: Grandma's house is broken. If there is time, I will fix Grandma's house.
indonesian: Rumah nenek sudah rusak. Jika ada waktu, saya akan memperbaiki rumah nenek.

balinese: Eda cening rengka, dum gelahé ajak nyama !
english: Don't be greedy! Let's share with our brother and sister.
indonesian: Jangan menjadi orang tamak ! Mari saling berbagi dengan saudara.

balinese: Dadong tiangé sampun réngkéd. Ipun mangkin ngijeng ring pondok.
english: My grandmother is not strong enough to walk. Now she stay at home.
indonesian: Nenek saya sudah tidak kuat berjalan. Sekarang dia diam di rumah.

balinese: Rengkuh karyané punika mangda gelis puput.
english: Do the task together so that it's finished quickly.
indonesian: Kerjakan bersama pekerjaan itu agar cepat selesai.

balinese: Liu anaké ngorahang tulisan tiangé renik.
english: Many people said that my writing is tiny but beautiful.
indonesian: Banyak orang yang mengatakan tulisan saya kecil-kecil indah.

balinese: Tiang renon nongos di Karangasem.
english: I like to live in Karangasem.
indonesian: Saya senang tinggal di Karangasem.

balinese: Eda cai rentang matur tekén guru !
english: Don't talk loudly to the teacher!
indonesian: Jangan kamu bicara bernada keras kepada guru !

balinese: Pepayasan ogoh-ogohé ento renteb gati.
english: The decoration of the ogoh-ogoh (giant doll) is very festive.
indonesian: Hiasan ogoh-ogoh (boneka raksasa) itu meriah sekali.

balinese: Wangunan puriné punika ngantos mangkin nénten naenin renteh.
english: Until now the castle building has never collapsed.
indonesian: Bangunan puri itu sampai sekarang tidak pernah runtuh.

balinese: Indayang mangkin rentehang sabuh wacanan ratuné majeng ring panjak sami.
english: Please now convey your orders to all the people.
indonesian: Silahkan sekarang sampaikan perintah anda kepada semua rakyat.

balinese: Sabuh wacana punika rentehanga rikalaning ida madeg ratu.
english: The king's order was issued when he served as king.
indonesian: Perintah raja itu dikeluarkannya ketika beliau menjabat sebagai raja.

balinese: Titiang nabung iriki santukan pacang polih rénten 3%.
english: I save here because I will get 3% of interest.
indonesian: Saya menabung di sini karena akan mendapat bunga uang 3%.

balinese: Putu ngelapin reong di banjar
indonesian: putu membersihkan instrumen reong di banjar

balinese: Kocapan, daweg Ida madeg ratu, nénten wénten sané purun ngrabéda jagat. Makasami panjaknyané rahayu. Rep satruné makasami santukan Ida kalintang wisésa. Makasami meseh Idané ngandap kasor.
english: People said that wheb he became king, no one dared to disturb the territory. All people are prosperous. All enemies are afraid because he is very powerful. All of his enemies surrender respectfully.
indonesian: Konon katanya, ketika beliau menjadi raja, tidak ada yang berani mengganggu wilayah. Semua rakyatnya sejahtera. Semua musuh takut karena beliau sangat sakti. Semua musuhnya menyerah dengan hormat.

balinese: Repah jatah bawiné punika, mangda makasami ulemané polih siki-siki. Elingang nagingin ajengan miwah lawar.
english: Share the pork satay so that all invitations can get it one by one. Don't forget to fill it with rice and lawar.
indonesian: Bagi sate babi itu agar semua undangan dapat satu per satu. Jangan lupa mengisinya dengan nasi dan lawar.

balinese: Ulam ayamé punika repaha dados sia potongan.
english: The chicken meat was divided by him into nine pieces.
indonesian: Daging ayam itu dibagi-baginya menjadi sembilan potongan.

balinese: Madé ngéncolang mragatang lukisanné ulian suba repeg.
english: Made by speeding up his painting because he was pressed for time.
indonesian: Made dengan mempercepat menyelesaikan lukisannya karena sudah terdesak waktu.

balinese: Ia suba répéh pesan ulian magadang maka telun.
english: He was very exhausted because he stayed up three days.
indonesian: Dia sudah sangat payah karena begadang tiga hari.

balinese: Jalan ané nuju umahné Wayan repit gati. Di sisin jalané pangkung, tur jalané cupit.
english: The road to Wayan's house is very difficult to pass. On the side of the road is a ravine, and the road is narrow.
indonesian: Jalan menuju rumah Wayan sangat sulit dilalui. Di sisi jalannya jurang, dan jalannya sempit.

balinese: Ipun reprep pisan santukan wénten wanara sané mongkod tundun ipuné.
english: He was very scared because there were monkeys who climbed his back.
indonesian: Dia sangat takut karena ada kera yang memanjat punggungnya.

balinese: Dugas melali ka Panglipuran, tiang biasa nolih bajang-bajang rerad-rerod sambilanga mepoto.
english: When traveling to Panglipuran, I used to see girls grouping here and there while taking pictures.
indonesian: Ketika berwisata ke Panglipuran, saya biasa melihat gadis-gadis berkelompok ke sana-kemari sambil berfoto.

balinese: Tiang mabasa Bali ritatkala mabaos sareng rerama.
english: I speak Balinese when I speak with my parents in the family.
indonesian: Saya berbahasa Bali pada saat berbicara dengan orang tua dalam keluarga.

balinese: Pianak nyinahang reramane, buka sesenggakkan, kija lakuna yehe membah.
english: Children are the reflection of their parents, like the proverb: where does the water go (referring to the fact that a child inherits the characteristics of his parents).
indonesian: Anak adalah cerminan orang tua, seperti pepatah kemana air mengalir?

balinese: "Napi anggen nganti plastik nika, Pak?" Buin Luh Ayu Manik matakon. "Liu, Luh, yening mablanja ka peken, tas kain aba. Yening ka pura canange wadahin sokasi. Keto masih yening lakar nunas tirta eda nganggen kresek, aba wadah tirtane uli jumah," Pak Budi ngorahin Luh Ayu Manik penggantin plastik. "Yen kenten uli dugas niki tiang pelih krana tiang setata nganggen plastik. Uli mangkin tiang jagi ngirangin nganggen plastik. Tiang taler jagi nekedang indike niki teken reraman tiange miwah timpal-timpal tiange," Luh Ayu Manik nglanturang. "Inggih, Luh, dumogi jagate ene tusing ja nglantas cemer sangkaning plastik," Pak Budi ngimbuhin mamunyi. "Nggih, Pak, suksma sampun ngicenin tiang piteket." "Nggih, Luh, suksma mawali."
english: "What will we use in place of plastic, Pak?” asked Luh Ayu Manik. "There are many possibilities, Luh. If you go shopping at the market, just take a cloth bag. If you go to the temple, put your offerings in a woven container. Similarly, when going to request holy water, don’t use plastic but bring a container from home.” These were the suggestions made by Pak Budi to Luh Ayu Manik on how to replace plastic. "If that is the case, then I have been wrong because I have always used plastic. From now on I’ll use less plastic. I’ll also tell my parents and friends about this,” Luh Ayu Manik added. "Yes, Luh, I hope our environment here has not already been contaminated with plastic,” Pak Budi added. "Yes, I hope so too, Pak. Thank you for giving me this advice.” "That’s OK, Luh. Thank you too."
indonesian: “Apa yang digunakan untuk mengganti plastik itu, Pak? Luh Ayu Manik bertanya lagi. “Banyak, Luh, jika berbelanja ke pasar, bawalah tas kain. Jika ke pura, wadahi canang dengan sokasi. Begitu pula ketika akan memohon air suci, jangan menggunakan plastik, bawalah wadah dari rumah,” Pak Budi menyarankan pengganti plastik kepada Luh Ayu Manik. “Jika begitu, berarti dari dulu saya salah karena selalu menggunakan plastik. Mulai saat ini saya akan mengurangi pemakaian plastik. Saya juga akan menyampaikan hal ini kepada orang tua dan teman-teman saya,” Luh Ayu Manik melanjutkan. “Iya, Luh, semoga alam ini tidak telanjur tercemar karena plastik,” Pak Budi menambahkan. “Iya, Pak, terima kasih telah memberikan saya nasihat.” “Iya, Luh, terima kasih kembali.”

balinese: Pekak mesaré di reranggon. Tiang nulungin pekak megarapan ka carik uli semengan.
english: Grandfather rested in ‘reranggon’. I helped grandpa to work in the fields since morning.
indonesian: Kakek beristirahat di dangau. Saya membantu kakek bekerja ke sawah sejak pagi.

balinese: Ngancan makelo kasugihanné ngancan rered.
english: His wealth decreases by the time.
indonesian: Semakin lama kekayaannya semakin berkurang.

balinese: Reredin ngalih bati, yén madagang bes mael nyanan liu anaké kapok mablanja dini.
english: Reduce the profit, if you sell too much, then many people will give up shopping here.
indonesian: Kurangi mencari laba, jika berjualan terlalu mahal, nanti banyak orang yang kapok berbelanja di sini.

balinese: Yen peta ane biasa rereh manten ring brosur-brosur, ten perlu numbas.
english: However, the regular map can be found on the brochures, no need to purchase it.
indonesian: Kalau peta yang biasa cari saja di brosur-brosur, tidak perlu beli.

balinese: Dibi sandé, ayam idané ical. Ayamé punika rereha ring abian, punika taler ring uma, sakéwanten nénten kapanggih.
english: Yesterday afternoon, he lost his chicken. He looked for the chicken in the garden, as well as in the fields, but it was not found.
indonesian: Kemarin sore, ayam beliau hilang. Ayam itu dicarinya ke kebun, begitu juga di sawah, tetapi tidak ditemukan.

balinese: Rerehang dumun lim anggén ngreketin kayuné puniki !
english: Find the glue to attach this wood!
indonesian: Carikan dulu lem untuk melekatkan kayu ini !

balinese: Rerembugan puniki mamargi saking tengai nyantos wengi.
english: This negotiation occured from noon to night.
indonesian: Perundingan ini berlangsung dari siang hingga malam.

balinese: Rérénang malu gaéné. Lan mesaré malu kejep. Kenjel sajan uli tuni tusing maan ngoyong.
english: Stop this job first. Let's rest for a while. We get tired for this endless work.
indonesian: Hentikan dulu pekerjaan ini. Mari istirahat dulu sebentar. Capek sekali dari tadi tidak dapat berhenti kerja.

balinese: Mobilé rérénanga di tengah jalané. Ento ané ngaénang jalané macet.
english: The car was stopped in the middle of the road. That caused the road to jam.
indonesian: Mobil itu dihentikan di tengah jalan. Itu yang menyebabkan jalan itu macet.

balinese: Tititang nénten midep ngaryanin rerenggan sané renteb.
english: I can't make a festive decoration.
indonesian: Saya tidak bisa membuat hiasan yang meriah.

balinese: Ida makta rerepi ka kantor pos. Titiang sane nyarengin ida merika.
english: He brought a letter to the post office. I accompanied him there.
indonesian: Beliau membawa surat ke kantor pos. Saya yang menemani beliau ke sana.

balinese: Tiang nulungin meme ngedasang rerigedan di natahe.
english: I helped my mother clean the dirt on the yard.
indonesian: Saya membantu ibu membersihkan kotoran yang ada di halaman.

balinese: Rerikrikan malinge ento suba tawanga teken polisine.
english: The thief's plan was known by the police.
indonesian: Rencana pencuri itu sudah diketahui oleh polisi.

balinese: I Meme rerimutan ulian pipisne palingina teken panak-panakne.
english: Mother was angry because her money was stolen by her children.
indonesian: Ibu marah karena uangnya dicuri oleh anak-anaknya.

balinese: Reringa nyemak be, eda bas liu, nyanan pang makejang maan duman.
english: Please presumably if you take a side dish, later so that all get a share.
indonesian: Kira-kirakan jika mengambil lauk, nanti agar semua mendapat bagian.

balinese: Reringain yen ngisinin uyah. Eda kanti jukute bas pakeh.
english: Estimate when filling salt. Do not until the vegetables are too salty.
indonesian: Perkirakan jika mengisi garam. Jangan sampe sayurannya terlalu asin.

balinese: Reringan bapane tusing taen pelih. Ento mawinan ia tusing bani nungkasin bapane.
english: His father's estimation was never wrong. That caused him not to dare to oppose his father.
indonesian: Perkiraan ayahnya tidak pernah salah. Itu yang menyebabkan dia tidak berani menentang ayahnya.

balinese: Reringgitan ane gaena teken Nyoman melah tur renteb gati.
english: The shape of the jagged coconut leaves made by Nyoman is nice and very festive.
indonesian: Bentuk hiasan janur bergerigi yang dibuat oleh Nyoman bagus dan meriah sekali.

balinese: Puisi sané mamurda ‘Denpasar sané Mangkin’ punika wantah reriptaan I Madé Sanggra.
english: The poem entitled 'Denpasar sane Mangkin' is a writting of I Made Sanggra.
indonesian: Puisi yang berjudul ‘Denpasar sane Mangkin’ itu adalah karangan I Made Sanggra.

balinese: Rerodan kursine bas dempet. Kisidang buin bedik apang ngidang anake liwat.
english: The row of chairs is too tight. Move a little more so people can pass.
indonesian: Deretan kursi itu terlalu rapat. Pindahkan lagi sedikit agar orang bisa melintas.

balinese: Rerodang kursine uli ditu neked mai. Yen kuangan kursi, jemakang buin di balene.
english: Line the chairs from there to here. If need more chair, get another one in the room.
indonesian: Bariskan kursi dari sana hingga sini. Jika kekurangan kursi, ambilkan lagi di ruangan.

balinese: Montor tamiune rerodanga di mukak wantilane ulian dini suba tusing ada tongos.
english: The guests' motorbikes were lined up by him in front of the multipurpose hall because there was no place here.
indonesian: Motor para tamu dibariskannya di depan balai serbaguna karena di sini sudah tidak ada tempat.

balinese: Bapa ngaé rerompok di cariké anggona tongos mesaré.
english: Father made a hut in the rice fields for a place to rest.
indonesian: Ayah membuat gubuk di sawah untuk tempat beristirahat.

balinese: Tiang ngorahin Nyoman apang melahang meséh satonden luas ka umahné Iluh, nanging penganggonné enu rerontogan.
english: I told Nyoman to dress well before going to Iluh's house, but his dress were still slobbery.
indonesian: Saya menyuruh Nyoman agar berdandan yang bagus sebelum pergi ke rumah Iluh, tetapi pakainnya masih kurang rapi.

balinese: Resem gati muane buka tusing mandus duang wai.
english: His face is very dirty like not bathing for two days.
indonesian: Kotor sekali wajahnya bagaikan tidak mandi selama dua hari.

balinese: Paripolahne resem gadem. Yen orahin apang kedas tusing runguanga.
english: His behavior is very disgusting. If I told him to make he looks clean, my advice is ignored.
indonesian: Perilakunya sangat menjijikkan. Jika diberitahu agar bersih tidak dihiraukan.

balinese: Resepang munyin bapa ene nah De, eda pesan memadat lan melaksana ane boya-boya.
english: Catch this father's words De, do not use illegal drugs from time to time and behave in a deviant manner.
indonesian: Resapi perkataan ayah ini ya De, jangan sekali-sekali menggunakan obat-obatan terlarang dan berperilaku yang menyimpang.

balinese: Ring karya puniki, titiang mendak resi bujangga.
english: At this ceremony, I invite a ‘resi bujangga’.
indonesian: Di upacara ini, saya mengundang resi bujangga.

balinese: Tiang jagi nglaksanayang upacara resi gana malih kalih rahina.
english: I will carry out a ‘resi gana’ ceremony in two days.
indonesian: Saya akan melaksanakan upacara ‘resi gana’ dua hari lagi.

balinese: Mangkin makasami karange sampun resik.
english: Now all the yards are clean.
indonesian: Sekarang semua pekarangan sudah bersih.

balinese: Resikin karange dumun sadurung mabanten.
english: Clean the yard first before giving offerings (sajen).
indonesian: Bersihkan pekarangan dulu sebelum menghaturkan banten (sajen).

balinese: Warung tiange suba ngelah surat ijin resmi uli pamrentah.
english: My stall already has an official permit from the government.
indonesian: Warung saya sudah memiliki surat izin resmi dari pemerintah.

balinese: Jalan tol Bali Mandara ento resmianga teken Gubernur Baline.
english: The Bali Mandara toll road was inaugurated by the Governor of Bali.
indonesian: Jalan tol Bali Mandara itu diresmikan oleh Gubernur Bali.

balinese: I Wayan suba maan restu uli bapanne Iluh. Buin duang bulan ia lakar nganten ngajak Iluh.
english: Wayan has received approval from Iluh’s father. In two months he will marry Iluh.
indonesian: Si Wayan sudah mendapat restu dari ayahnya Iluh. Dua bulan lagi ia akan menikah dengan Iluh.

balinese: Ret kenehe meli motor yen dot ngelah pipis anggon mayah sekolah !
english: Hold the desire to buy a motorcycle first if you want to have money to pay for school!
indonesian: Tahan dulu keinginan membeli motor jika ingin punya uang untuk membayar sekolah !

balinese: Tiang nulungin meme ngae jaja reta di paon.
english: I helped my mother make reta cakes in the kitchen.
indonesian: Saya membantu ibu membuat kue reta di dapur.

balinese: Krana ia enu inget teken munyin iklane di tipine, ia makeneh matakon teken reramanne. Ri kala memene suba di jumah, Ia lantas nakonang unduke ento. "Me, tunian tiang ningeh di tipine, i raga kone musti nguangin nganggon tas plastik. Apa ane makada? Apake plastik totonan jelek?" "Meme tusing nawang, Luh. Buina meme sabilang wai nganggon kresek, kanti jani tusing ja kenapa-kenapa. Mirib lakar ane anggona ngae plastik suba keweh ngalih, Luh," keto memenne mamunyi. "Oh, keto. Tumben tiang ningeh," Luh Ayu Manik mamunyi keto. "Meme masih mara taen ningeh. Tegarang mani gurune di sekolahan takonin," keto munyin memenne. "Nah, Me, mani tiang lakar matakon teken gurune," Luh Ayu Manik nyautin.
english: She kept thinking about the message she had seen on TV, and so decided to talk to her mother about it. When her mother arrived home, Luh asked her about it.  "Mom, I saw on television that we have to reduce the use of plastic bags. What is the reason for that? Is plastic bad? " "I don't know, Luh. What’s more, I use plastics bags every day too and until now there haven’t been any problems. Maybe the material used to make plastic has become hard to get, Luh,” her mother said. "Oh, I see. It's the first time I’d heard of it, " said Luh Ayu Manik. "It’s the first time I’d heard of it too. Tomorrow ask your teacher at school about it," her mother said. "OK, Mom … tomorrow I’ll ask my teacher," Luh Ayu Manik replied.
indonesian: Karena ia masih teringat dengan iklan di televisi tersebut, ia berniat menanyakannya pada ibunya. Saat ibunya sudah di rumah, lalu ia bertanya. “Bu, tadi saya lihat di televisi, katanya kita harus mengurangi penggunaan tas plastik. Kenapa begitu? Apakah plastik itu jelek?” “Ibu tidak tahu, Luh. Di samping itu, ibu setiap hari juga menggunakan tas plastik, sampai sekarang tidak ada masalah. Mungkin bahan yang digunakan untuk membuat plastik sudah sulit dicari, Luh,” demikian kata ibunya. “Oh, begitu. Tumben saya dengar,” kata Luh Ayu Manik.   “Ibu juga baru pertama kali mendengarnya. Cobalah besok tanyakan pada gurumu di sekolah,” demikian kata ibunya. “Iya, Bu, besok saya akan menanyakannya kepada guru saya,” jawab Luh Ayu Manik.

balinese: Yakti, jeg kenak pisan, panggihin tiang Beli Eka, riantukan ngarahina maurukin yoga , nggih Beli?
english: Really, I can see that you look so fresh, Brother Eka. Because by teaching yoga, you gain that appearance, right brother?
indonesian: Serius, sehat sekali saya lihat Kak Eka. Karena setiap hari mengajarkan yoga, ya Kak?

balinese: Nuju masan panen, jinenge enu ribek misi padi.
english: Towards the harvest period, the barn is still full of rice.
indonesian: Menuju masa panen, lumbung masih penuh berisi padi.

balinese: Ibi ada anak tua mabaju ricek macelep ka umah tiange.
english: Yesterday there was a shabby-out old man who entered my house.
indonesian: Kemarin ada orang tua berpakaian lusuh masuk ke rumah saya.

balinese: Ricekang kainne ento apang nyak marenges.
english: Make the fabric looks shabby so it looks scary.
indonesian: Lusuhkan kain itu agar terlihat angker/menakutkan.

balinese: Kamben ogoh-ogohe ricekanga apang ngenah serem.
english: The ogoh-ogoh (giant doll) cloth is made to be shabby to make it look scary.
indonesian: Kain ogoh-ogoh (boneka raksasa) itu dilusuhkannya agar terlihat seram.

balinese: Anake di kota ngae demo kanti ricu. Polisine lantas teka kemu.
english: People in the city made a demo until they were troubled. The police then came there.
indonesian: Orang di kota membuat demo hingga ricuh. Polisi kemudian datang ke sana.

balinese: Tulang jerijine ridek ulian lilig montor di jalane.
english: His finger bone was crushed because of being run over by a motorbike on the road.
indonesian: Tulang jarinya remuk karena terlindas motor di jalan.

balinese: Pondok dadong tiange suba riet. Jani dadong ngoyong sig umah tiange.
english: My grandmother's cottage has been damaged. Now grandma lives in my house.
indonesian: Pondok nenek saya sudah rusak. Sekarang nenek tinggal di rumah saya.

balinese: Iluh suba sesai nganggo sandal tegeh. Nanging, yen majalan riged pesan.
english: Iluh often uses high sandals. But, if it runs very slowly.
indonesian: Iluh sudah sering menggunakan sandal tinggi. Tetapi, jika berjalan sangat lambat.

balinese: Ia dogen ane ngae riget di jumah.
english: He is the only one who messed up at home.
indonesian: Dia saja yang berbuat kacau di rumah.

balinese: Irika wenten toya sane milir saking gununge. Saking riin, kramane ngrereh toya irika.
english: There is water flowing from the mountain. Since long ago, residents have been looking for water there.
indonesian: Di sana ada air yang mengalir dari gunung. Sejak dahulu, para warga mencari air di sana.

balinese: Genah sane riinan cupitan sareng genah sane mangkin.
english: The first place is narrower than the current place.
indonesian: Tempat yang dulu lebih sempit dari tempat yang sekarang.

balinese: Titiang nunas mangda ida dane trepti. Mangda mamargi antar, riinang anak lingsire ngranjing.
english: I appeal to the audience to be orderly. In order to make this event run smoothly, let old people entering first.
indonesian: Saya mohon agar hadirin tertib. Supaya berjalan lancar, dahulukan orang tua masuk.

balinese: Durus riinin mamargi, titiang nenten uning genahnyane.
english: Please go ahead first, I do not know the place.
indonesian: Silahkan dahului berjalan, saya tidak tahu tempatnya.

balinese: Mangkin sampun meweh ngrereh bunga rijasa.
english: Now it's hard to find ‘Elaeocarpus grandiflorus’ flower.
indonesian: Sekarang sudah susah mencari bunga ‘Anyang-anyang’.

balinese: I Bapa rijek megarapan di carik uli semengan.
english: Father is busy working in the rice fields from morning.
indonesian: Ayah sibuk bekerja di sawah dari pagi.

balinese: Meme mula rijig di abian badelod.
english: Mothers plant ‘rijig’ beans in the southern garden.
indonesian: Ibu menanam kacang ‘rijig’ di kebun sebelah selatan.

balinese: Kamarne Made rikat ulian bajune mabrarakan ditu.
english: Made's room was not free because his clothes were scattered there.
indonesian: Kamarnya Made tidak leluasa karena bajunya berserakan di sana.

balinese: Rikrik malu ajak makejang satonden iraga luas keme.
english: Plan before we go there.
indonesian: Rencanakan terlebih dahulu sebelum kita pergi ke sana.

balinese: Rikrikang malu teken timpal-timpale apang nyanan tusing ada alangan.
english: Plan first with friends so that later there will be no obstacles.
indonesian: Rencanakan dulu dengan teman-teman agar nanti tidak ada halangan.

balinese: Titiang mrasa rikuh pisan matur ring anak lingsir.
english: I am feel very less free to talk to people who are old.
indonesian: Saya merasa sangat kurang bebas berbicara dengan orang yang sudah tua.

balinese: Tiang jejeh negakin sepedanne Wayan ulian tusing misi rim.
english: I was afraid to ride Wayan's bicycle because it didn't contain brakes.
indonesian: Saya takut mengendarai sepedanya Wayan karena tidak berisi rem.

balinese: Tiang suba rimang sekat nolih Putu ngigel di kampus.
english: I have fallen in love since I saw Putu dancing on campus.
indonesian: Saya sudah jatuh cinta sejak melihat Putu menari di kampus.

balinese: Makelo-makelo yen tusing pragatang, urusan tiange ene dadi rimbit.
english: Over time if it is not resolved, my business becomes complicated.
indonesian: Lama-lama jika tidak diselesaikan, urusan saya ini menjadi rumit.

balinese: Yen lakar luas matajen, pekak stata ngaba rimpi di tasne.
english: If he is going to go to cockfighting, grandpa always carries a box of spurs blade in his bag.
indonesian: Jika akan pergi mengadu ayam, kakek selalu membawa kotak tempat taji di tasnya.

balinese: Makasami satrune sampun rimpung. Ida kalintang sakti santukan prasida ngrimpung mesehe sami.
english: All enemies have perished. He is very powerful because he can destroy all of his enemies.
indonesian: Semua musuh sudah binasa. Beliau sangat sakti karena bisa membinasakan semua musuhnya.

balinese: Satrune rimpunga makasami ring payudan.
english: The enemy was destroyed by all on the battlefield.
indonesian: Musuhnya dibinasakan olehnya semua di medan perang.

balinese: Meme rimrim ulian adin tiange tusing mulih uli semengan. Tiang orahina ngalih ka umah timpalne.
english: Mother was worried because my sister hadn't come home since morning. I was told to look for it at a friend's house.
indonesian: Ibu khawatir karena adik saya tidak pulang sejak pagi. Saya disuruh mencarinya ke rumah temannya.

balinese: Disubane mulih uli sekolah dinane ento, ia tumben langsung mabalih tv. Sujatine ia tusing biasa mabalih tv teka uli sekolah. Ri kala tipine idupanga, dapetanga siarane tusing melah. Ia lantas nyemak rimut lan ngalih-alihin acara tipi ane melah. Ping telu nglecekang rimut, saget ia nepukin ada iklan di silih tunggil stasiun tipi. Isin iklane ento tuah apang krama Baline nguangin nganggon tas plastik. Apabuin jani suba ada peraturan ane ngatur unduke ento. Suud iklane ento, tipine matianga lantas ia masalin tur madaar.
english: When she got home from school that day, she decided to watch TV even though it was not usual for her to watch TV after school. When she turned the TV on, the program was not very interesting so she picked up the remote control and searched for a good program. She changed the channel three times and then she saw an ad on the station she was watching. The aim of the ad was to encourage Balinese people to reduce the use of plastic bags … particularly now that there are regulations in place. She turned the TV off after watching the ad, changed her clothes and then had something to eat.
indonesian: Sepulangnya dari sekolah hari itu, tumben ia langsung menonton televisi. Tidak biasanya ia menonton televisi selepas sekolah. Saat televisinya dihidupkan, ia mendapati siaran yang tidak bagus. Ia lalu mengambil remot dan mencari-cari acara yang bagus. Tiga kali menekan remot, tiba-tiba ia melihat iklan di salah satu stasiun televisi. Isi iklan tersebut adalah agar warga Bali mengurangi penggunaan tas plastik. Apalagi sekarang sudah ada peraturan yang mengatur hal tersebut. Ia mematikan televisi seusai iklan itu. Lalu ia berganti pakaian dan makan.

balinese: Eda malu luas keme yen tusing ngelah rincik ane melah.
english: Don't go there if you don't have a good plan.
indonesian: Jangan dulu pergi ke sana jika belum punya rencana yang bagus.

balinese: Adin tiange dot pesan meli rindik sekat nolih timpalne bisa megambel rindik.
english: My sister wants to buy ‘rindik’ since seeing her friend who can play a ‘rindik’ musical instrument.
indonesian: Adik saya ingin sekali membeli ‘rindik’ semenjak melihat temannya yang bisa memainkan alat musik ‘rindik’.

balinese: Titiang mabasa Bali ri tatkala titiang ngayah ring banjar.
english: I speak Balinese when I worked together in banjar.
indonesian: Saya berbahasa Bali pada saat saya gotong royong di banjar.

balinese: Adi: Galeri ring dija nika, Beli? Yoga: Ring panti asuhan.
english: Adi: Where is this gallery Brother? Yoga: At an orphanage.
indonesian: Adi: Galeri di mana itu, Kak? Yoga: Di panti asuhan.

balinese: Ia mablanja di dagange limang ringgit
indonesian: Dia berbelanja di dagang itu lima ringgit.

balinese: Busunge ringgita aji mutik teken Wayan.
english: The coconut leaf is made into a tooth-shaped decoration by Wayan.
indonesian: Janur itu dibuatkan hiasan berbentuk gerigi oleh Wayan.

balinese: Ringgitang jep busung memene, Luh. Meme lakar nyakan di paon malu.
english: Make a shape like a tooth on the coconut leaf. Mother will cook rice in the kitchen first.
indonesian: Buatkan bentuk seperti gerigi pada janur ibu Luh. Ibu akan menanak nasi di dapur dulu.

balinese: Kubun tiange ringgung ulian kena angin nglinus.
english: My hut almost collapsed due to a whirlwind.
indonesian: Gubuk saya hampir roboh karena terkena angin puyuh.

balinese: Ringkes tikehe apang tusing daki kena buk.
english: Roll the mat so it doesn't get dirty from dust.
indonesian: Gulung tikar itu agar tidak kotor terkena debu.

balinese: Ringkus malingé apang tusing malaib.
english: Catch the thief from running away.
indonesian: Ringkus pencuri itu agar tidak lari.

balinese: Maling sampiné ringkusa di uma dugas nagih melaibin sampiné ento.
english: The cow thief was arrested in the rice field when he wanted to take the cow away.
indonesian: Pencuri sapi itu diringkusnya di sawah ketika ingin membawa lari sapi itu.

balinese: Montorné ringsek tomplok trek di sisin jalané.
english: The motorbike was crushed hit by a truck on the side of the road.
indonesian: Motornya ringsek ditabrak truk di pinggir jalan.

balinese: Yén suba ngortang pipis, I Wayan ringsun gati.
english: If we have talked about money, Si Wayan is so caring.
indonesian: Jika sudah membicarakan uang, Si Wayan perhitungan sekali.

balinese: Tiang orahina mulih ngalihin rinti tekén mémé.
english: I was told to go home to take the ‘rinti’ (thread for ceremonial equipment) by mother.
indonesian: Saya disuruh pulang mengambil benang rinti oleh ibu.

balinese: Ripeh krama desané kena grubug. Sabilang wai ramé gati di puskesmas.
english: All villagers were sick of the plague. Every day is very crowded in the health center.
indonesian: Semua warga desa sakit kena wabah. Setiap hari ramai sekali di puskesmas.

balinese: Rain tiuké riprip ulian sesai anggona ngerot tiing.
english: The blade is jagged because every day used to cut the bamboo.
indonesian: Mata pisau itu bergerigi karena setiap hari digunakan meraut bambu.

balinese: Tegarang ripta dumun puisi indik rahina Galungan !
english: Try to compose a poem about Galungan day!
indonesian: Coba karang dulu puisi tentang hari Galungan !

balinese: Sad ripu sané wénten ring padéwékan, patut pisan kasorang mangda nénten kantos ngrebeda ring kahuripan.
english: Six enemies that are in themselves, must be defeated so as not to interfere with life.
indonesian: Enam musuh yang ada pada diri, harus di kalahkan agar tidak sampai mengganggu kehidupan.

balinese: Mémé meli kamben songkét a rirang di peken Badung.
english: Mother bought one sheet songket cloth at the Badung market.
indonesian: Ibu membeli kain songket satu lembar di pasar Badung.

balinese: Nyoman mula punyan jagung duang ririg di cariké.
english: Nyoman planted two rows of corn trees in a rice field.
indonesian: Nyoman menanam pohon jagung dua leret di sawah.

balinese: Ririgan punyan jagungé bas démpét.
english: The rows of corn plant were too tight.
indonesian: Leretan pohon jagung itu terlalu rapat.

balinese: Ririgang montoré ditu apang tusing ngandang jalan.
english: Align the motorbike there so it doesn't block the road.
indonesian: Leretkan motor itu di sana agar tidak menghalangi jalan.

balinese: Kursiné ririganga uli badaja kanti badelod natah umahné.
english: He lined the chair from north to south of his yard.
indonesian: Kursi itu dileretkannya dari utara hingga selatan halaman rumahnya.

balinese: Eda mapi-mapi ririh yén mula tusing nawang apa !
english: Don't pretend to be smart if you don't know anything !
indonesian: Jangan pura-pura pandai jika memang tidak tau apa !

balinese: Dibi sanja tiang nongos jumah ulian ujan riris.
english: Yesterday afternoon I stayed at home because of the drizzling.
indonesian: Kemarin sore saya diam di rumah karena hujan gerimis.

balinese: Celepang saangé ento ka rirunné ento Dé !
english: Put the firewood into the hole beside the stove, De !
indonesian: Masukkan kayu bakar itu ke lubang samping tungku De !

balinese: Pabiananné risak pesan sawiréh ia nyampat ditu sabilang sanja.
english: His plantation was very clean because he swept there every afternoon.
indonesian: Perkebunannya sangat bersih karena dia menyapu di sana setiap sore.

balinese: Risakin malu abiané satondén pulain kacang.
english: Clean the garden first before planting peanuts.
indonesian: Bersihkan dulu kebun itu sebelum ditanami kacang.

balinese: Abian ento risakina satondén kapulain kacang.
english: The garden was cleaned by him before planting peanuts.
indonesian: Kebun itu dibersihkannya sebelum ditanami kacang.

balinese: Tiang tusing baanga malali ka umahné sawireh koné ia anak riseb.
english: I was not allowed to play at his house because people said he was a bad person.
indonesian: Saya tidak diizinkan bermain ke rumahnya karena katanya dia orang jahat.

balinese: “Sakit keneh gelahé ningeh munyinné ané buka kéto, tusing buungan lakar risebin jelema totonan !” kéto sautné Jero Gedé.
english: "It hurts me when I hear his words like that, without any reason, I will hurt that person with evil powers!" Said Jero Gede.
indonesian: “Sakit hati saya mendengar perkataannya yang seperti itu, tidak mau tau akan saya sakiti orang itu dengan kekuatan jahat !” begitu kata Jero Gede.

balinese: Nyaman tiangé risebina kanti tusing ngidang bangun.
english: My brother was hurted by evil forces so he could not get up.
indonesian: Saudara saya diganggunya dengan kekuatan jahat hingga tidak bisa bangun.

balinese: Kalih rahina sané lintang, titiang rauh ka pawiwahan idané. Wenginé punika uleman idané riuh pisan.
english: Two days ago, I came to his marriage. That night the invitees were very crawded.
indonesian: Dua hari yang lalu, saya datang ke pernikahan beliau. Malam itu para undangan beliau sangat riuh.

balinese: Umah tiangé peteng riut ulian listriké mati lan tusing ngelah lilin.
english: My house was pitch black because of electricity and no candles.
indonesian: Rumah saya gelap gulita karena mati listrik dan tidak mempunyai lilin.

balinese: Ia tusing ngerunguang riweg panakné.
english: He ignored his son's whining.
indonesian: Dia tidak menghiraukan rengek anaknya.

balinese: Di sekolah tongos iraga malajah lan ngalih roang.
english: At the school where we study and look for friends.
indonesian: Di sekolah tempat kita belajar dan mencari kawan.

balinese: Roangin tiang ngalih saang ka alasé nah Dé !
english: Accompany me looking for firewood in the forest De!
indonesian: Temani saya mencari kayu bakar ke hutan ya De !

balinese: Madé roangina ngalih busung ka peken tekén adinné.
english: Made was accompanied by his sister to look for coconut leaf at the market.
indonesian: Made ditemani mencari janur ke pasar oleh adiknya.

balinese: Punyané ento rob gati. Nuju masan ujan, liu gati aasan doné makacakan di jalané.
english: The tree is very lush. Towards the rainy season, many leaves fall on the road.
indonesian: Pohon itu rimbun sekali. Menuju musim hujan, banyak dedaunan yang berjatuhan di jalan.

balinese: Akuda liun roban Wayanné di jumah ?
english: How many Wayan family members are at home?
indonesian: Berapa banyak anggota keluarga Wayan di rumah ?

balinese: Ia makamben bes kabet nganti robed ia majalan.
english: He wears too tight cloth so it is less free to walk.
indonesian: Ia memakai kain terlalu sesak sehingga kurang bebas berjalan.

balinese: Don kayuné ento robrob. Tusing ada anak ané bani ngenteb punyané ento.
english: The wood leaves are lush and dangling. No one dared to cut down the tree.
indonesian: Daun kayu itu rimbun dan berjuntai. Tidak ada orang yang berani menebang pohon itu.

balinese: “Robrobin idup anak ané tusing ngelah” keto raos I pekak tekén tiang.
english: "Shade the lives of people who don't have it," grandfather told me.
indonesian: “Naungi hidup orang yang tidak punya” begitu perkataan kakek kepada saya.

balinese: Sepedan adin tiangé misi roda tatelu.
english: My sister's bicycle contains three wheels.
indonesian: Sepeda adik saya berisi tiga roda.

balinese: Rodain wadah luluné ento apang aluh ngaba kemu mai.
english: Fit the wheels in the trash can to easily carry it everywhere.
indonesian: Pasangi roda pada tempat sampah itu agar mudah membawa kemana-mana.

balinese: Mejané rodaina aji bor lan paku.
english: The table was installed with wheels using a drill and nails.
indonesian: Meja itu dipasanginya roda menggunakan bor dan paku.

balinese: Dugas pidan liu anaké sengsara ulian orahina rodi tekén penjajahé.
english: In the past many people were miserable because they were told to work hard without pay by the invaders.
indonesian: Dahulu banyak orang yang sengsara karena disuruh kerja paksa tanpa upah oleh penjajah.

balinese: Baisné rodrod ulian kena knalpot panes.
english: His leg was injured chipped because of being hit by a hot exhaust.
indonesian: Kakinya terluka terkelupas karena terkena knalpot panas.

balinese: I Madé mula roga. Abulan bisa pang telu ia maubad ka dokter.
english: Made is indeed often had sick. She can go to the doctor for three times.
indonesian: Si Made memang sakit-sakitan. Sebulan bisa tiga kali dia ke dokter.

balinese: Liman anak ceriké ento rogés meong kanti magetih.
english: The little boy's hand was scratched by the cat to bleed.
indonesian: Tangan anak kecil itu dicakar kucing hingga berdarah.

balinese: Liman tiangé rogésa kanti magetih.
english: My hand was clawed by it until it bleed.
indonesian: Tangan saya dicakarnya hingga berdarah.

balinese: Tatunné rograg ulian tusing ubadina kanti jani.
english: His wound is big because it is not treated until now.
indonesian: Lukanya besar karena tidak diobati hingga sekarang.

balinese: Rogragang abedik kainné ento apang tusing ampehang angin.
english: Rip off the cloth a little so it won't get blown away.
indonesian: Robekkan sedikit kain itu agar tidak terhempas angin.

balinese: Gigin dadong tiangé suba rogrog.
english: My grandmother's teeth are toothless.
indonesian: Gigi nenek saya sudah ompong.

balinese: Kamen tiangé makilit di roji montorné Madé.
english: My cloth was caught in Made's motorcycle chain.
indonesian: Kain saya tersangkut di rantai motornya Made.

balinese: Iluh tusing demen nganggo rok. Ia sabilang wai nganggo jalér.
english: Iluh doesn't like to wear a skirt. Every day he uses pants.
indonesian: Iluh tidak suka menggunakan rok. Setiap hari dia menggunakan celana.

balinese: Tiang tusing demen matimpal ngajak anak ané ngelah daya rokang.
english: I don't like to be friends with people who have cunning sense.
indonesian: Saya tidak suka berteman dengan orang yang punya akal licik.

balinese: Tiang taén nolih rokét tuah di tipiné dogén.
english: I have seen rockets only on television.
indonesian: Saya pernah melihat roket hanya di televisi saja.

balinese: Boni: Ten ngadol roko, Mbok? Adi tiang ten nyingakin wenten roko deriki? Ayu: Mbok sampun ten ngadol roko malih, Gus.
english: Boni: Do you sell cigarette, Sister? How come I don’t see any cigarette here? Ayu: I am no longer selling cigarette, Gus.
indonesian: Boni: Menjual rokok tidak, Kak? Kok saya tidak lihat ada rokok di sini? Ayu: Kakak sudah tidak menjual rokok lagi, Gus.

balinese: Ida nénten madué roma sesampuné nambanin pinakit kanker.
english: He did not have hair after treatment for cancer.
indonesian: Beliau tidak punya rambut setelah berobat penyakit kanker.

balinese: Di Tabanan ada peken ané ngadep baju rombéngan, adané peken Kodok.
english: In Tabanan there is a market that sells secondhand clothes, its name is Kodok market.
indonesian: Di Tabanan ada pasar yang menjual baju bekas, namanya pasar Kodok.

balinese: Rombo Pan Wayan ngajang batako ditu Yan !
english: Help Mr. Wayan carry the brick at there Yan!
indonesian: Bantu Pak Wayan mengangkut batako di sana Yan !

balinese: Pisaganné rombona ngajang batako lan bias.
english: His neighbors was helped by him to transport concrete blocks and sand.
indonesian: Tetangganya dibantunya mengangkut batako dan pasir.

balinese: Rombong dagang raoné bah ulian ampehang angin nglinus.
english: The Soto seller cart fell because of a strong wind.
indonesian: Rombong dagang soto itu jatuh karena terhempas angin kencang.

balinese: Rombongan saking Denpasar wawu rauh iriki jam 7 wengi.
english: The group from Denpasar just arrived here at 7pm.
indonesian: Rombongan dari Denpasar baru tiba di sini jam 7 malam.

balinese: Anaké ento romon pesan. Lén pesan tekén nyamanné ané putih kedas.
english: That person is so dirty. It's very different from his pure white brother.
indonesian: Orang itu kotor sekali. Berbeda sekali dengan saudaranya yang putih bersih.

balinese: Pengawakné Wayan rompéng. Pedalem tiang nolih Wayan buka kéto.
english: The stature of Wayan is thin and weak. It’s a pity when I see Wayan like that.
indonesian: Perawakannya Wayan kurus dan lemah. Kasihan saya melihat Wayan seperti itu.

balinese: Dadong tiangé suba rompod. Ento mawinan jani dadong tusing buin ka abian.
english: My grandmother is not strong enough to walk. That's why grandma is no longer in the garden.
indonesian: Nenek saya sudah tidak kuat berjalan. Itu sebabnya sekarang nenek tidak lagi ke kebun.

balinese: Rompok totonan suba tusing dadi tongosin.
english: The hut can’t not occupied anymore.
indonesian: Gubuk itu sudah tidak bisa ditempati.

balinese: Limanné gasgasa dogén sabilang wai ulian rompot.
english: His hands are constantly scratched every day because they are full of scabies.
indonesian: Tangannya digaruk terus setiap hari karena penuh kudis.

balinese: Nyoman meli ron di peken anggona ngaé pénjor.
english: Nyoman bought the old palm leaves on the market to make penjor.
indonesian: Nyoman membeli daun enau yang agak tua di pasar untuk membuat penjor.

balinese: Tiang lan Madé maan tugas ronda nyanan petengné.
english: Made and I got a patrol assignment later tonight.
indonesian: Saya dan Made mendapat tugas ronda nanti malam.

balinese: Ujan-ujan kéné mula paling jaen ngalih rondé.
english: When its raining like this, it's most delicious to drink ronde.
indonesian: Hujan-hujan begini memang paling nikmat minum ronde.

balinese: Jani Wayan suba ngidang ngaé umah yadiastun tuah duang rong.
english: Now Wayan is able to make a house even though there are only two rooms.
indonesian: Sekarang Wayan sudah bisa membuat rumah walaupun hanya dua bilik.

balinese: Giginné pekak suba rongak, tusing bisa buin makpak kacang.
english: Grandfather's teeth are stretchy, can't bite the beans anymore.
indonesian: Giginya kakek sudah renggang, tidak bisa menggigit kacang lagi.

balinese: Pidan awakné Wayan ronggé. Nanging jani suba ngamokohang dogén.
english: In the past, the body was tall and thin. But now it's getting fatter.
indonesian: Dulu badannya wayan kurus tinggi. Tetapi sekarang sudah semakin gemuk saja.

balinese: Jagung ané pulaina tekén Pan Wayan liunan rongoh.
english: The corn planted by Mr. Wayan is mostly have a rarely seed.
indonesian: Jagung yang ditanam oleh Pak Wayan kebanyakan bijinya sedikit.

balinese: Cariké rongrong blabar dibi sanja. Padiné makejang usak baana.
english: The paddy fields were flooded yesterday afternoon. All the paddy plant is broken.
indonesian: Sawah itu dirongrong banjir kemarin sore. Semua padinya rusak.

balinese: I Putu sabilang wai munduhang rontal ané lakar adepa sig Pan Wayané. Pan Wayan ané lakar ngolah rontalé ento dadi piranti nyurat aksara Bali.
english: Putu collects palm leaves every day to sell to Mr. Wayan. Mr. Wayan, who will process lontar leaves for a media to write Balinese script.
indonesian: Si Putu setiap hari mengumpulkan daun lontar yang akan dijual kepada Pak Wayan. Pak Wayan yang akan mengolah daun lontar itu menjadi media untuk menulis aksara Bali.

balinese: Tiang ajak Madé orahina masang ronték di pura tekén Bapa.
english: Made and I were told to put up banners in the temple by my father.
indonesian: Saya dan Made disuruh memasang umbul-umbul di pura oleh ayah.

balinese: Tusing ada anak ané demen tekén jlema rontok !
english: No one likes a dirty person!
indonesian: Tidak ada orang yang suka dengan orang yang jorok !

balinese: Tiang meli kacang duang rontong aji limang tali rupiah di warungné Madé.
english: I bought two cans of beans for five thousand rupiah in Made's stall.
indonesian: Saya membeli kacang dua kaleng seharga lima ribu rupiah di warungnya Made.

balinese: Suba jam roras, nanging ia tondén masih teka mai.
english: It's twelve o'clock, but he hasn't come here yet.
indonesian: Sudah jam dua belas, tetapi dia belum juga datang kemari.

balinese: Rorodang I Putu yén reramanné tusing ngrestuin.
english: Ask Putu to elope if his parents do not approve.
indonesian: Ajaklah Si Putu kawin lari jika orang tuanya tidak merestui.

balinese: Tunanganné rorodanga ulian tusing maan restu uli reramanné.
english: His girlfriend was invited to eloped because he did not get the blessing of her parents.
indonesian: Pacarnya diajak kawin lari olehnya karena tidak mendapat restu dari orang tuanya.

balinese: Téhel umahné roron-roron sekat ada linuh dibi sanja.
english: The floor of his house has been uneven since there was an earthquake yesterday afternoon.
indonesian: Lantai rumahnya tidak rata sejak ada gempa kemarin sore.

balinese: Getep ros tiingé ento nganggon regaji !
english: Cut the bamboo segment using a saw!
indonesian: Potong ruas bambu itu menggunakan gergaji !

balinese: Bungan punyan pohé rosros nuju masan ujan.
english: The mango tree flowers fall towards the rainy season.
indonesian: Bunga pohon mangga itu gugur menuju musim hujan.

balinese: “Rot potloté ento aji tiuk !” kéto raosné bapa.
english: "Sharpen the pencil using a knife!" Father said.
indonesian: “Raut pensil itu menggunakan pisau!” begitu kata ayah.

balinese: Katik saténé rota aji tiuk mangan gati.
english: The skewer was whittled by him using a very sharp knife.
indonesian: Tusukan sate itu dirautnya menggunakan pisau yang sangat tajam.

balinese: Rotan tiingé ané suba pragat jemuha di natahé kanti tuh satondén ngaé layangan.
english: The result of whittling the bamboo has been dried in the yard to dry before making kites.
indonesian: Rautan bambu yang sudah jadi dijemur di halaman hingga kering sebelum membuat layangan.

balinese: Rotang malu katik saténé apang lanying satondén ngaé saté.
english: Firstly, whittle the skewer to make it pointy before making satay.
indonesian: Rautkan dulu tusukan satenya agar runcing sebelum membuat sate.

balinese: Tiingé ento rotanga apang sisinné tusing mangan.
english: The bamboo was whittled so the edge not to be sharp.
indonesian: Bambu itu dirautnya agar sisinya tidak tajam.

balinese: Royong gaéné ené apang énggal pragat lan tusing bas tuyuh.
english: Do this work together so that it is fast and not too tiring.
indonesian: Kerjakan pekerjaan ini bersama agar cepat selesai dan tidak terlalu melelahkan.

balinese: Gaéné royonga apang énggal pragat. Disubané pragat, makejang magibung di wantilan desané.
english: The work was done together so that it was quickly completed. After completion, everyone eat meals together at Wantilan (village hall).
indonesian: Pekerjaan itu dikerjakan bersama-sama agar cepat selesai. Setelah selesai, semua makan bersama di wantilan (balai desa).

balinese: Ruakang tanahné pekak ané bedangin, Dé !
english: Open a new land in the grandfather's land to the east, Dé!
indonesian: Buka lahan baru di tanah kakek yang di sebelah timur, Dé !

balinese: Sekadi ruan taruné punika sané nénten naenin kroda ring angin sané ngampehang ipun.
english: Like the leaves of a tree that is never angry with the wind that blows it away.
indonesian: Bagaikan daun pohon yang tidak pernah marah kepada angin yang menghempaskannya.

balinese: Getep ruas tiingé ento nganggon regaji !
english: Cut the bamboo segment using a saw!
indonesian: Potong ruas bambu itu menggunakan gergaji !

balinese: Ruat manahé mangda prasida ngemanggihang pamargi sané pinih becik.
english: Clean your mind so you can find the best way.
indonesian: Bersihkan pikiran agar bisa menemukan jalan yang terbaik.

balinese: Umahné rubuh dugas ada linuh dibi sanja. Aget tusing ada anak ané tepén wangunan.
english: His house collapsed when there was an earthquake yesterday afternoon. Fortunately, no one was hit by the building.
indonesian: Rumahnya roboh ketika ada gempa kemarin sore. Untung tidak ada orang yang tertimpa bangunan.

balinese: “Yan, rubuhang baléné bedaja ento, bapa lakar ngaé balé ané anyar ditu”, kéto raosné bapa.
english: "Yan, knock down the building in the north, father will build a new building there," said father.
indonesian: “Yan, robohkan bangunan di utara itu, ayah akan membangun bangunan baru di sana”, begitu kata ayah.

balinese: Dugas tiang ngantén, tiang nganggo rubung malakar mas lan pérak.
english: When I married, I used gold and silver earrings.
indonesian: Ketika saya menikah, saya menggunakan giwang berbahan emas dan perak.

balinese: Sasuratan adin tiangé rucek ulian tumbén nyurat di lontar.
english: My sister's writing was broken because she was in the first time writing on palm leaf.
indonesian: Tulisan adik saya rusak karena pertama kali menulis di lontar.

balinese: Tiang tusing demen malajah ditu sawiréh rudeg anak cenik.
english: I do not like to study there because it is disturbed by the children.
indonesian: Saya tidak suka belajar di sana karena diganggu anak kecil.

balinese: Ingetang mabanten apang tusing rudega baan kalané.
english: Remember to offer offerings not to be disturbed by oleh bhuta kala ’(evil and destructive spirits).
indonesian: Ingatlah mempersembahkan sajen agar tidak diganggu oleh ‘bhuta kala’ (makhluk-makhluk halus yang jahat dan bersifat merusak).

balinese: Kwacan idané keni rudira sané milir saking tangan idané.
english: His clothes were exposed to blood flowing from his hands.
indonesian: Baju beliau terkena darah yang mengalir dari tangannya.

balinese: Ruet gati keneh tiangé ulian gaéné éné tusing pragat kanti jani.
english: Mind mind is so mess because this job isn't finished until now.
indonesian: Kacau sekali pikiran saya karena pekerjaan ini tidak selesai hingga sekarang.

balinese: Jagat Badungé rug gebug penjajah saking Belanda daweg nika.
english: The Badung country (region of Bali) was break down destroyed by invaders from the Netherlands at that time.
indonesian: Negara Badung (daerah di Bali) hancur diserang penjajah dari Belanda pada saat itu.

balinese: Rugeh pipisé ané taén siliha tekén Wayan ! Suba duang bulan tonden ulianga.
english: Ask the money that has been borrowed by Si Wayan by force ! It hasn't been returned in two months.
indonesian: Minta dengan paksa uang yang pernah dipinjam oleh Si Wayan ! Sudah dua bulan belum dikembalikan.

balinese: Eda nuutang solahné Wayan. Pipis reramanné rugeha anggona melali ajak tunanganné.
english: Don't follow Wayan's behavior. His parents' money was forcibly requested to go with his girlfriend.
indonesian: Jangan mengikuti perilakunya Wayan. Uang orang tuanya diminta dengan paksa untuk pergi bersama pacarnya.

balinese: Keneh tiangé ruget pesan ulian ningeh orta ané tidong-tidong.
english: My mind was very freaked out by hearing the news that it was okay.
indonesian: Pikiran saya sangat kalut karena mendengar kabar yang tidak-tidak.

balinese: Melahang maitungan apang tusing rugi.
english: Carefully when calculate so you don't lose.
indonesian: Baik-baiklah menghitung agar tidak rugi.

balinese: Liu anaké rugianga baan ngorahang ngidang mindoin pipis.
english: Many people are harmed by them by saying they can make double money.
indonesian: Banyak orang yang dirugikannya dengan mengatakan bisa menggandakan uang.

balinese: Rugrag temboké ento aji linggis, Yan !
english: Unload the wall using a crowbar, Yan!
indonesian: Bongkar tembok itu menggunakan linggis, Yan !

balinese: Luluné rugrag-rugrug di natahné ulian tusing kedasina uli ibi.
english: The garbage was scattered in the yard of his house because he had not cleaned it from yesterday.
indonesian: Sampah itu berhamburan di halaman rumahnya karena tidak dibersihkannya dari kemarin.

balinese: Jalané ané enu melah buin rugraga ulian liunan pipis.
english: The road that is still good is being demolished again because of too much money.
indonesian: Jalan yang masih bagus dibongkarnya lagi karena terlalu banyak uang.

balinese: Rugrugang penganggoné di keranjangé ento, eda sambehina di kamaré.
english: Collect the clothes in the basket, don't scatter them in the room.
indonesian: Kumpulkan pakaian itu di keranjang itu, jangan dicecerkan di kamar.

balinese: Tangan idané keni rui ning taru.
english: His hand was hit by tree thorns.
indonesian: Tangan beliau terkena duri pohon.

balinese: Dugasé ento, tiang nolih Ketut sedeng ngalih ruing cunguh nganggon jerijinné.
english: At that moment I saw Ketut was busy looking for nostrils dirt with his fingers.
indonesian: Pada saat itu saya melihat Ketut sedang asyik mencari kotoran lubang hidung dengan jarinya.

balinese: Nyambuné ento rujaka tekén Iluh ajak timpal-timpalné.
english: The water guava was made rujak by Iluh and his friends.
indonesian: Jambu air itu dijadikan rujak oleh Iluh dan teman-temannya.

balinese: Rujakang nyambuné ento apang tusing makutang-kutang.
english: Make the water guava salad to not be wasted.
indonesian: Jadikan rujak jambu air itu agar tidak terbuang-buang.

balinese: Bokné Wayan jani rujit, tusing buin magambahan cara pidan.
english: Wayan's hair is now short, no longer decomposed as before.
indonesian: Rambutnya Wayan sekarang pendek, tidak lagi terurai seperti dulu.

balinese: Bok tiangé rujita tekén bapa. Tiang tusing baanga mabok lantang.
english: My hair is cut short by my father. I am not permitted to have long hair.
indonesian: Rambut saya dicukur pendek oleh ayah. Saya tidak diizinkan berambut panjang.

balinese: Ida kocap akéh madué rukmi miwah mirah.
english: People said he had lots of gold and gems.
indonesian: Beliau katanya banyak memiliki emas dan permata.

balinese: Titiang ngantenang rukuh ring musium.
english: I saw ‘rukuh’ (a war hat covering the head to the nape of the neck) in the museum.
indonesian: Saya melihat ‘rukuh’ (topi perang yang menutupi kepala sampai tengkuk) di museum.

balinese: I raga patut setata rukun manyama braya.
english: We must always get along with our brothers and sisters and be in a community.
indonesian: Kita harus selalu rukun bersaudara dan bermasyarakat.

balinese: Rum ning puspita ngalimurang manah.
english: Fragrant flowers cheer hearts.
indonesian: Harumnya bunga menghibur hati.

balinese: Adukang rumbah lan jukut nangkané kanti rata.
english: Mix the chopped seasoning and vegetable jackfruit until blended.
indonesian: Campurkan bumbu cincang dan sayur nangka itu hingga rata.

balinese: Eda engsapina ngaé rumbah gilé anggon ngisinin banten pengabénanné.
english: Don't forget to make ah ‘rumbah gile’ to fill the offerings for the ceremony.
indonesian: Jangan lupa membuat ‘rumbah gile’ untuk mengisi sesajen upacara pengabenan.

balinese: Tiang rumbang dugas orahina masuk ka luar negri.
english: I was hesitant when I was told to go to school abroad.
indonesian: Saya bimbang ketika disuruh sekolah ke luar negeri.

balinese: Tanduk sampiné misi rumbing mawarna barak.
english: The cow's horn contains a red "rumbing" (decoration on the horn).
indonesian: Tanduk sapi itu berisi ‘rumbing’ (hiasan pada tanduk) berwarna merah.

balinese: Rumbingin tanduk sampiné satondén milu makepung.
english: Attach the 'rumbing' (cow horn decoration) on the horn of the cow before taking ‘makepung’ (cart race drawn by a pair of buffaloes or cows)
indonesian: Pasangi ‘rumbing’ (hiasan tanduk sapi) pada tanduk sapi itu sebelum mengikuti ‘makepung’ (balap cikar yang ditarik oleh sepasang kerbau atau sapi).

balinese: Rumik anaké mabalih wayang di pura.
english: The people that watching puppets at the temple was not crowded.
indonesian: Tidak ramai orang menonton wayang di pura.

balinese: Soal ulangan matematikané rumit gati. Kanti pengeng tiang mragatang.
english: The math exam questions are very difficult. Until I was confused I finished it.
indonesian: Soal ujian matematika itu sulit sekali. Hingga pusing saya menyelesaikannya.

balinese: Rumitang nga soal apang tusing aluh baana nyaurin teken muride.
english: Make questions more complicated so it's not too easy for students to answer them.
indonesian: Buat soal lebih rumit agar tidak terlalu mudah bagi siswa untuk menjawabnya.

balinese: Pekak demen gati nganggo rompi ané mawarna gadang ento.
english: Grandpa likes to wear that green vest.
indonesian: Kakek suka sekali memakai rompi yang berwarna hijau itu.

balinese: Makejang nyaman-nyamané teka rumpiuk di taman kota.
english: All of his brothers came to gather in the city park
indonesian: Semua saudara-saudaranya datang berkumpul di taman kota

balinese: Rumpiukang timpalé makejang, yén suba genep mara luas kema.
english: Gather all your friends, if it's complete then go there.
indonesian: Kumpulkan teman-teman semua, jika sudah lengkap barulah berangkat ke sana.

balinese: Murid-muridé rumpiukanga tekén guruné di lapanganngé tuni semengan.
english: The students were gathered by his teacher in the field this morning.
indonesian: Murid-murid itu dikumpulkan oleh gurunya di lapangan tadi pagi.

balinese: Siapné Wayan ané mawarna barak lan misi rumpuk.
english: Wayan's chicken is red and contains a compound comb.
indonesian: Ayamnya Wayan yang berwarna merah dan berisi jengger majemuk.

balinese: Melah gati udengné Madé buka rumpukan sari.
english: Made’s ‘udeng’ (traditional Balinese headband) is very nice like a tiered flower crown.
indonesian: Bagus sekali udengnya (ikat kepala tradisional Bali) Made bagaikan mahkota bunga bersusun.

balinese: Liunang ngisinin tabia di rumrahé ento apang masa lalah !
english: Fill more chili in "rumrah" (spices as a filling from the roasted pork belly) to taste spicy.
indonesian: Perbanyak mengisi cabai di ‘rumrah’ (rempah-rempah sebagai isian dari perut babi panggang) supaya berasa pedas.

balinese: Rumrum I Wayan apang nyak teka mai.
english: Persuade Si Wayan to come here.
indonesian: Bujuk Si Wayan agar mau datang kemari.

balinese: I Ketut rumruma apang nyak masuk sekolah.
english: The Ketut was persuaded by him to want to go to school.
indonesian: Si Ketut dibujuk olehnya agar mau sekolah.

balinese: Rumrumang panak tiangé apang nyak masekolah !
english: Please persuade my child to go to school!
indonesian: Tolong bujuk anak saya agar mau bersekolah !

balinese: Rundah bayuné ulian ningeh orta tunangan tiangé ngajak anak muani lénan.
english: My heart is not calm when I heard the news of my boyfriend with another man.
indonesian: Tidak tenang hati saya mendengar kabar pacar saya bersama lelaki lain.

balinese: Rundingang malu tekén krama ané lenan satondén ngaé putusan.
english: Negotiate with other citizens before making a decision.
indonesian: Rundingkan dahulu dengan warga yang lain sebelum membuat keputusan.

balinese: Pawangunan baléné ento rundinganga ajak nyaman-nyamanné.
english: The construction of the building was negotiated with his brothers.
indonesian: Pembangunan gedung itu dirundingkannya bersama-saudara-saudaranya.

balinese: Rungka gati dugas tiang nglamar dadi pegawé ditu.
english: It’s very difficult when I applied to become an employee there.
indonesian: Susah sekali ketika saya melamar menjadi pegawai di sana.

balinese: Dadong tiangé suba rungkad. Jani dadong tuah nongos di jumah.
english: My grandmother had difficulty walking because of old age. Now grandma just stays at home.
indonesian: Nenek saya sudah susah berjalan karena lanjut usia. Sekarang nenek hanya diam di rumah.

balinese: Panakné Wayan mula rungsing. Demen gati ia ngengkebang sandal tiangé.
english: Wayan’s son is indeed nosy. He likes to hide my sandals.
indonesian: Anaknya Wayan memang usil. Dia suka sekali menyembunyikan sendal saya.
