balinese: Eda kija-kija malu Luh, runguang panaké dini !
english: Don't go anywhere Luh, watch your child here!
indonesian: Jangan kemana-mana Luh, perhatikan anakmu di sini !

balinese: Panakné tusing runguanga ulian seleg magaé di kota.
english: His son ignored by him because he was busy working in the city.
indonesian: Anaknya tidak dihiraukannya karena sibuk bekerja di kota.

balinese: Runtag atin tiangé ulian panak tiangé tonden mulih kanti jani.
english: My heart is nervous because my child hasn't returned home until now.
indonesian: Hati saya gelisah karena anak saya belum pulang hingga sekarang.

balinese: “Runti bajun tiangé ané uék ento !”, keto raosné Pan Wayan.
english: "Sew my torn clothes by hands! ", Said Pak Wayan.
indonesian: "Jahit baju saya yang robek itu dengan tangan !”, begitu kata Pak Wayan.

balinese: Runtik gati anak ceriké totonan. Suba pang pindo sandal tiangé engkebanga.
english: That little kid is so nosy. He has hidden my sandal twice.
indonesian: Usil sekali anak kecil itu. Sudah dua kali sendal saya disembunyikannya.

balinese: Bantang taruné punika sampun renyah, punika mawinan runtuhanga mangda nénten wénten sané katiban.
english: The trunk of the tree is already fragile, which is why it was dropped so that nothing was crushed.
indonesian: Batang pohon itu sudah rapuh, itu sebabnya dijatuhkannya agar tidak ada yang tertimpa.

balinese: Alon-alon yéning nedun lontar mangda runtun.
english: Be careful when copying lontar (Balinese literature that uses rontal leaf media) so that it is sequential.
indonesian: Hati-hati jika menyalin lontar (pustaka Bali yang menggunakan media daun rontal) agar berurutan.

balinese: Runtutan acara puniki kakawitin antuk sembrama wacana saking bapak kepala sekolah.
english: The sequence of this event began with remarks from the principal.
indonesian: Urutan acara ini dimulai dengan sambutan dari bapak kepala sekolah.

balinese: Runyam gati panakné Madé. Makejang barang tiangé nagih pantiganga.
english: Made’s son can't keep motionless. All of my stuff want to be slammed by him.
indonesian: Anaknya Made tidak bisa diam. Semua barang saya ingin dibantingnya.

balinese: Putu pepesan runyuh yén ngaba motor. Suba pang pindo ia nomplok punyan nyuh di sisin jalané.
english: Putu often is not careful when riding a motorcycle. He hit a coconut tree on the side of the road twice.
indonesian: Putu sering kurang hati-hati jika mengendarai motor. Sudah dua kali dia menabrak pohon kelapa di pinggir jalan.

balinese: Ogoh-ogoh sané kakaryanin oleh para yowanané punika nyihnayang rupa raksana sané serem-serem.
english: Ogoh-ogoh (giant doll) made by young men characterizes a appearance of spooky monster.
indonesian: Ogoh-ogoh (boneka raksasa) yang dibuat oleh para pemuda mencirikan rupa raksasa yang seram-seram.

balinese: Ia ngréka lukisan anak bajang ané rupawan.
english: He painted a paintings of beautiful teenage girls.
indonesian: Dia melukis lukisan gadis remaja yang cantik.

balinese: Kamarné Wayan rupek buina kebus gati.
english: Wayan's room is narrow and very hot.
indonesian: Kamarnya Wayan sempit dan panas sekali.

balinese: Tiang nyilih pipis satus tali rupiah sig Pan Wayané.
english: I borrowed one hundred thousand rupiah at Pak Wayan.
indonesian: Saya meminjam uang seratus ribu rupiah di Pak Wayan seratus.

balinese: Yadiastun nyonyoné rupit, ia tileh jegég.
english: Even though her breasts are small, she is still beautiful.
indonesian: Walaupun payudaranya kecil, dia tetap cantik.

balinese: Tiang orahina ka peken tekén mémé dugas enu ruput.
english: I was told to go to the market by my mother in the early hours of the morning.
indonesian: Saya disuruh ke pasar oleh ibu ketika masih pagi-pagi buta.

balinese: Carik tiangé rurah ulian kena blabar.
english: My rice fields were damaged because of floods.
indonesian: Sawah saya rusak karena terkena banjir.

balinese: Komputer tiangé ruraha kanti tusing dadi buin anggon ngetik.
english: My computer was damaged by him so it can't be used to type again.
indonesian: Komputer saya dirusak olehnya hingga tidak bisa digunakan mengetik lagi.

balinese: I Nyoman buung ngantén ulian reramanné nadak tusing ngrestuin. Unduké ento rurianga tekén krama desané kanti jani.
english: I Nyoman failed to get married because his parents suddenly did not approve. It was made horrendous by the villagers until now.
indonesian: Si Nyoman batal menikah karena orang tuanya mendadak tidak merestui. Hal itu dihebohkan oleh warga desa hingga sekarang.

balinese: Belingannné Iluh ruru ulian ulung uli undagané.
english: Her womb is abort because she fall from the stairs.
indonesian: Kandungannya Iluh gugur karena jatuh dari tangga.

balinese: Taru puniki sané ruruh titiang, sané pacang kadadosang tamba.
english: This tree is what I'm looking for, which I will make medicine.
indonesian: Pohon ini yang saya cari, yang akan saya jadikan obat.

balinese: Umahné Madé jani tusing ngelah rurung pamesuan ulian urug longsor.
english: Made's house now has no way to get out because it was buried by a landslide.
indonesian: Rumahnya Made sekarang tidak punya jalan untuk keluar karena ditimbiun longsor.

balinese: Mamargi kemanten ring margi sané rurus puniki, yéning sampun rauh ring tanggun margi, drika grian idané.
english: Just walk on this straight road, if you has arrived at the end of the road, there is his house.
indonesian: Jalan saja di jalan yang lurus ini, jika sudah tiba di ujung jalan, di sana rumah beliau.

balinese: Rurusang batisé apang tusing liu nelahang tongos.
english: Straighten your legs so you don't spend too much space.
indonesian: Luruskan kakimu agar tidak banyak menghabiskan tempat.

balinese: Sepédan titiangé sampun rusak. Titiang nénten madué jinah anggén menain ring béngkél.
english: My bicycle is damaged. I don't have money to fix it in the workshop.
indonesian: Sepeda saya sudah rusak. Saya tidak punya uang untuk memperbaikinya di bengkel.

balinese: Ipun mupulang rusak-rusakan sané pacang adola malih ring pasar.
english: He collected something that had been damaged which he would sell again on the market.
indonesian: Dia mengumpulkan sesuatu yang telah rusak yang akan dijual kembali olehnya di pasar.

balinese: Wusan ngrusak méja lan kursi, mangkin pintuné sané rusaka.
english: After damaging the table and chairs, now the door was broken by it.
indonesian: Sesudah merusak meja dan kursi, sekarang pintu itu yang dirusak olehnya.

balinese: Arta brananné engkebanga di tongos ané rusia.
english: His treasure was hidden by him in a secret place.
indonesian: Harta bendanya disembunyikan olehnya di tempat yang rahasia.

balinese: Eda rusit tekén gelah timpal !
english: Don't be nosy with people’s things !
indonesian: Jangan usil dengan kepunyaan orang !

balinese: Anak ané ngaé rusuh dugas ada konsér di desané ento suba juka tekén polisiné.
english: People who made riots when there was a concert in the village were arrested by the police.
indonesian: Orang yang membuat rusuh ketika ada konser di desa itu sudah ditangkap polisi.

balinese: Kapur tulisé suba rutrut. Beliang buin di toko badaja.
english: The chalk is short. Buy it again at the north store.
indonesian: Kapur tulisnya sudah pendek. Belikan lagi di toko sebelah utara.

balinese: Pejalané adéng-adéng pesan buka anak ruyud.
english: His walk is slow like someone who is not powerful.
indonesian: Jalannya pelan-pelan sekali seperti orang yang tidak bertenaga.
